alert.note: Alert for Rota (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Typhoon Warning issued October 10 at 3:28AM ChST until further notice by NWS Guam
info.description: ...TROPICAL STORM BOLAVEN MOVING NORTHWEST... .NEW INFORMATION... None. .AREAS AFFECTED... This local statement provides recommended actions for people in Guam and the Northern Marianas. .Watches/Warnings... A Typhoon Warning continues for Rota, Tinian, and Saipan. A Tropical storm warning and a Typhoon Watch continues for the following locations, Guam. A Flood Watch is in effect for all of Guam and the Northern Marianas. Please listen closely for any Flood Warnings that might be in effect for your area. .STORM INFORMATION... At 1 AM ChST...the center of Tropical Storm Bolaven (15W) was located near Latitude 12.3N...Longitude 148.0E. This was about 230 miles east-southeast of Guam. Storm motion was northwest at 14 mph. Storm intensity was 65 mph. .SITUATION OVERVIEW... Tropical Storm Bolaven is expected to pass between Rota and Tinian as a category 1 or 2 typhoon this evening. Winds will be the biggest threat followed by flooding and coastal inundation. Conditions will begin to improve Wednesday. .PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... .NEXT UPDATE... The next local statement will be issued by the National Weather Service in Tiyan around 9 AM ChST...or sooner if conditions warrant. ...Typhoon Warning remains in effect... ...PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... ...Probability of tropical storm/typhoon conditions... Typhoon conditions are likely this evening and tonight. This is a steady trend since the last local statement. ...Winds... As Bolaven moves closer, the threat for sustained high winds will increase, first coming from the north to northwest today, then shifting to west to southwest as Bolaven passes to the north tonight. The latest forecast is for tropical storm force winds from late this morning to Wednesday morning and typhoon force winds from late this afternoon to late this evening, peaking at 65 to 75 mph, gusting to 90 mph or higher. ...Coastal inundation and surf information... Inundation of up to 6 feet is possible as Bolaven passes nearby, especially during high tide around 6 PM this evening. Hazardous surf conditions are expected beginning today and continuing through at least Thursday. The highest surf conditions are expected to begin along east and possibly south facing reefs today as Bolaven nears. Surf will increase and likely become dangerous, exceeding 15 ft, for north and west facing reefs on Wednesday as Bolaven passes to the northwest of the Marianas. ...Inland flooding... A Flood Watch is in effect for the entire area. See latest forecast for latest information. Listen for possible flood warnings for your location...and be ready to act if flooding rains occur. Soils are already wet from previous rainfall, so it won`t take much to cause flooding.
info.instruction: For those under a warning...now is the time to rush to completion preparations for the protection of life and property. Evacuate if directed to do so by local officials...or if your home is vulnerable to high winds or flooding. The arrival of damaging winds is likely within the next several hours. For interests at ports...docks...and marinas...urgently complete prescribed preparations according to your emergency operations plan for tropical cyclones. If you live on a boat...make final preparations for securing your craft before leaving it. Regarding any coastal waters under a warning...small craft should remain in port and well secured. Closely monitor NOAA weather radio or other local news outlets for official storm information. Listen for possible changes to the forecast. For additional precautionary and preparedness information... Please refer to the detailed recommendations relative to your location as further described by your local National Weather Service office and local emergency management.
